channel.title: Masochistic updating?
channel.description:
Perhaps it would be possible to once again use an aryanesque updater by using a tool such as ASMifier or BCELifier. Though i dont see any major advantages, i was just attempting to broaden the horizons a little.
I have no intentions on following this path, i was merely hoping to bring about some discussion of plausibility.

item.title: Masochistic updating?
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

VB substring (like) updater with CFPARSE. It took approximately 5m20s to download, parse, change, save, and recompile the code with his updater. lol if it was done properly like say, in BCEL? it’d be done in about 5ms?

Read full topic

item.title: Masochistic updating?
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

pplsuqbawlz:

You mean the instruction finder that is broke in 5.2 and still (but far less so) flawed in 5.1?

When did 5.2 happen? What did they break?

If I remember correctly, isn’t this what Sythe did for the first Scarscape? Gasm and a VB editor?

Read full topic

item.title: Masochistic updating?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I suggested writing an updater this way in the past, and SeanWT said it was a stupid idea and a waste of time. I still like it though, I might actually go this route.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Masochistic updating?
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

Ok, I don’t have a clue what masochistic means, but ok, I assume you mean finding fields and such and replacing them using regular expressions…
What advantage exactly would that provide over using the regular way of updating with bytecode injection?
(Well, ot that I know how exactly that’d work as I’m not a java coder, but I’ve done some client editting in the past so I’m interrested… )

Read full topic
